sect1.title: Introduction
sect1.para: &app; is desktop mapping software. It was designed to be fun and useful for everyone, not just highly technical people.
This document will help you go 0 to 60 in no time.

sect1.title: Window Layout
sect1.para: The main window. The individual parts of this window are described below.

sect2.title: Toolbar
sect2.para: The toolbar provides access to the most useful map navigation operations.

listitem.para: Back Button. The Back button takes you to the last place you were looking at. It works in a similar way to the Back button in your web browser. No matter how you move the map, clicking Back will undo the movement.
Forward Button. After using the Back button, you can click Forward to return to where you were. It works in a similar way to the Forward button in your web browser.
Zoom-Out Button. Zoom out one level. When you are zoomed out as far as possible, the button will be grayed out. and unavailable.
Zoom Slider. The slider allows you to quickly zoom to any level. Click and drag the slider to zoom.
Zoom-In Button. Zoom in one level. When you are zoomed in as far as possible, the button will be grayed out. and unavailable.
Search Entry. Read more about how to use the search, see the section titled How to Search.

note.para: Many of the operations available on the toolbar can also be performed using Shortcut Keys.

sect2.title: Sidebar
sect2.para: To read more about what information shows up on the sidebar and how to use it, head on over to the Using the Sidebar section.

sect1.title: How to Search
sect1.para: This section will show you how to perform searches in &app; and offers some tips for improving the results you get.

sect2.title: Search Basics
sect2.para: To start a search, enter search words into the search box in the upper right corner of the main window, and then hit the Enter key on your keyboard. Some example searches you could try now:
After performing a search, the search results sidebar tab will automatically be displayed. Click on one of the results to view the location.

note.para: Don't worry about losing your current spot, you can use the Back Button to return to it later.

sect2.title: Finding Places
sect2.para: The search box can also find places like restaurants, schools, and police stations. Try these searches:
Notice that some searches have a city name in them. When you include a city name in your search, &app; will try to find Places in or near that city.
When you don't specify a city in your search, &app; will find Places nearby where you are currently looking.

itemizedlist.listitem: When searching in &app;, capitalization doesn't matter. The word PIZZA is treated the same as Pizza and even PiZZa. They will all get the same results.
Punctuation like commas, quotation marks, pluses, minuses, and parentheses are ignored.
If you get too many search results, try adding more search words.
If you get too few search results, try removing one or more search words.

sect1.title: Shortcut Keys
sect1.para: You can use the keyboard to perform all of the operations available in &app;. Most of these operations have a keyboard shortcut. The available shortcuts are listed below.

sect1.title: About Roadster
sect1.para: The &app; project was started by Ian McIntosh in early 2005. His goal was to create a Free Software alternative to the proprietary mapping applications available at the time. He also hoped to make something more fun to use, and to provide a platform on which others could innovate.
